refnamediv.refpurpose: The base class of the GTK+ type hierarchy

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: Description
refsect2.para: GtkObject is the base class for all widgets, and for a few non-widget objects such as GtkAdjustment. GtkObject predates GObject; non-widgets that derive from GtkObject rather than GObject do so for backward compatibility reasons.

GtkObjects are created with a "floating" reference count. This means that the initial reference is not owned by anyone. Calling g_object_unref() on a newly-created GtkObject is incorrect, the floating reference has to be removed first. This can be done by anyone at any time, by calling g_object_ref_sink() to convert the floating reference into a regular reference. g_object_ref_sink() returns a new reference if an object is already sunk (has no floating reference).

GtkWindow is a special case, because GTK+ itself will ref/sink it on creation. That is, after calling gtk_window_new(), the GtkWindow will have one reference which is owned by GTK+, and no floating references.

One more factor comes into play: the "destroy" signal, emitted by the gtk_object_destroy() method. The "destroy" signal asks all code owning a reference to an object to release said reference. So, for example, if you call gtk_object_destroy() on a GtkWindow, GTK+ will release the reference count that it owns; if you call gtk_object_destroy() on a GtkButton, then the button will be removed from its parent container and the parent container will release its reference to the button. Because these references are released, calling gtk_object_destroy() should result in freeing all memory associated with an object, unless some buggy code fails to release its references in response to the "destroy" signal. Freeing memory (referred to as finalization only happens if the reference count reaches zero.

Some simple rules for handling ""
Never call g_object_unref() unless you have previously called g_object_ref(), even if you created the GtkObject. (Note: this is not true for GObject; for GObject, the creator of the object owns a reference.)
Call gtk_object_destroy() to get rid of most objects in most cases. In particular, widgets are almost always destroyed in this way.
Because of the floating reference count, you don't need to worry about reference counting for widgets and toplevel windows, unless you explicitly call g_object_ref() yourself.

refsect2.title: GtkObject
refsect2.para: The object itself. You should never use these members directly - use the accessing macros instead.

refsect2.title: GTK_OBJECT_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Gets the type of an object.

refsect2.title: GTK_OBJECT_TYPE_NAME()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of an objects type.

refsect2.title: enum GtkObjectFlags
refsect2.para: Tells about the state of the object.

listitem.simpara: the object is currently being destroyed. This is used internally by GTK+ to prevent reinvokations during destruction.

refsect2.title: GTK_OBJECT_FLAGS()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkObjectFlags for an object without directly accessing its members.

listitem.simpara: the object whose flags are returned.

refsect2.title: GTK_OBJECT_FLOATING()

warning.para: GTK_OBJECT_FLOATING is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Evaluates to TRUE if the object still has its floating reference count. See the overview documentation for GtkObject.

refsect2.title: enum GtkArgFlags

warning.para: GtkArgFlags is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use corresponding GParamSpec features instead

refsect2.para: Possible flags indicating how an argument should be treated.

listitem.simpara: the argument is readable. (i.e. can be queried)

the argument needs construction (and will be set once during object creation), but is otherwise cannot be set. Hence this flag is not allowed with GTK_ARG_WRITABLE, and is redundant with GTK_ARG_CONSTRUCT.
an argument type that applies to (and may be different for) each child. Used by GtkContainer.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_new ()

warning.para: gtk_object_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_new() instead.

refsect2.para: Constructs an object given its arguments, enumerated in the call to the function.

listitem.simpara: the type identifying this object. Returned by gtk_type_unique() (although for a properly-written object it should be accessible through a GTK_TYPE_FOO macro.)
name of the first property to set when constructing the object.
the first argument's value, followed by any number of name/argument-value pairs, terminated with NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_sink ()

warning.para: gtk_object_sink has been deprecated since version 2.10 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_ref_sink() instead

refsect2.title: gtk_object_ref ()

warning.para: gtk_object_ref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_ref() instead.

refsect2.para: Increases the reference count of the object.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_unref ()

warning.para: gtk_object_unref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_unref() instead.

refsect2.para: Decreases the reference count of an object. When its reference count drops to 0, the object is finalized (i.e. its memory is freed).

refsect2.title: gtk_object_weakref ()

warning.para: gtk_object_weakref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_weak_ref() instead.

refsect2.para: Adds a weak reference callback to an object. Weak references are used for notification when an object is finalized. They are called "weak references" because they allow you to safely hold a pointer to an object without calling g_object_ref() (g_object_ref() adds a strong reference, that is, forces the object to stay alive).

listitem.simpara: callback to invoke before the object is freed.
extra data to pass to notify.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_weakunref ()

warning.para: gtk_object_weakunref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_weak_unref() instead.

refsect2.para: Removes a weak reference callback to an object.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Emits the "destroy" signal notifying all reference holders that they should release the GtkObject. See the overview documentation at the top of the page for more details.

The memory for the object itself won't be deleted until its reference count actually drops to 0; gtk_object_destroy() merely asks reference holders to release their references, it does not free the object.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_get ()

warning.para: gtk_object_get is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_get() instead.

refsect2.para: Gets properties of an object.

listitem.simpara: name of first property to get the value for.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set ()

warning.para: gtk_object_set is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set() instead.

refsect2.para: Sets properties on an object.

listitem.simpara: name of the first property to set
the value of the first argument, followed optionally by more name/value pairs, followed by NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set_data ()

warning.para: gtk_object_set_data is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_data() instead.

refsect2.para: Each object carries around a table of associations from strings to pointers. This function lets you set an association.
If the object already had an association with that name, the old association will be destroyed.

listitem.simpara: data to associate with that key.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set_data_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_object_set_data_full (GtkObject *object, const gchar *key, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);

warning.para: gtk_object_set_data_full is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_data_full() instead.

refsect2.para: Like gtk_object_set_data() except it adds notification for when the association is destroyed, either by gtk_object_remove_data() or when the object is destroyed.

listitem.simpara: data to associate with that key.
function to call when the association is destroyed.

refsect2.condition: deprecated:Use g_object_set_data() to set the object data to %NULL instead.
refsect2.title: gtk_object_remove_data ()

warning.para: gtk_object_remove_data is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_data() to set the object data to NULL instead.

refsect2.para: Removes a specified datum from the object's data associations (the object_data). Subsequent calls to gtk_object_get_data() will return NULL.
If you specified a destroy handler with gtk_object_set_data_full(), it will be invoked.

listitem.simpara: name of the key for that association.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_get_data ()

warning.para: gtk_object_get_data is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_get_data() instead.

refsect2.para: Get a named field from the object's table of associations (the object_data).

listitem.simpara: name of the key for that association.
the data if found, or NULL if no such data exists.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_remove_no_notify ()

warning.para: gtk_object_remove_no_notify is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_steal_data() instead.

refsect2.para: Remove a specified datum from the object's data associations (the object_data), without invoking the association's destroy handler.
Just like gtk_object_remove_data() except that any destroy handler will be ignored. Therefore this only affects data set using gtk_object_set_data_full().

listitem.simpara: name of the key for that association.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set_user_data ()

warning.para: gtk_object_set_user_data is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_data() instead.

refsect2.para: For convenience, every object offers a generic user data pointer. This function sets it.

listitem.simpara: the object whose user data should be set.
the new value for the user data.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_get_user_data ()

warning.para: gtk_object_get_user_data is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_get_data() instead.

refsect2.para: Get the object's user data pointer.
This is intended to be a pointer for your convenience in writing applications.

listitem.simpara: the user data field for object.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_add_arg_type ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_object_add_arg_type (const gchar *arg_name, GType arg_type, guint arg_flags, guint arg_id);

warning.para: gtk_object_add_arg_type is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated in favor of the GObject property system including GParamSpec. Add a new type of argument to an object class. Usually this is called when registering a new type of object.

listitem.simpara: fully qualify object name, for example GtkObject::user_data.
bitwise-OR of the GtkArgFlags enum. (Whether the argument is settable or gettable, whether it is set when the object is constructed.)
an internal number, passed in from here to the "set_arg" and "get_arg" handlers of the object.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set_data_by_id ()

warning.para: gtk_object_set_data_by_id is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_qdata() instead.

refsect2.para: Just like gtk_object_set_data() except that it takes a GQuark instead of a string, so it is slightly faster.
Use gtk_object_data_try_key() and gtk_object_data_force_id() to get an id from a string.

listitem.simpara: data to associate with that key.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_set_data_by_id_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_object_set_data_by_id_full (GtkObject *object, GQuark data_id, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);

warning.para: gtk_object_set_data_by_id_full is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_qdata_full() instead.

refsect2.para: Just like gtk_object_set_data_full() except that it takes a GQuark instead of a string, so it is slightly faster.
Use gtk_object_data_try_key() and gtk_object_data_force_id() to get an id from a string.

listitem.simpara: data to associate with that key.
function to call when the association is destroyed.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_get_data_by_id ()

warning.para: gtk_object_get_data_by_id is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_get_qdata() instead.

refsect2.para: Just like gtk_object_get_data() except that it takes a GQuark instead of a string, so it is slightly faster.
Use gtk_object_data_try_key() and gtk_object_data_force_id() to get an id from a string.

listitem.simpara: the data if found, or NULL if no such data exists.

refsect2.condition: deprecated:Use g_object_set_qdata() with data of %NULL instead.
refsect2.title: gtk_object_remove_data_by_id ()

warning.para: gtk_object_remove_data_by_id is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_set_qdata() with data of NULL instead.

refsect2.para: Just like gtk_object_remove_data() except that it takes a GQuark instead of a string, so it is slightly faster.
Remove a specified datum from the object's data associations. Subsequent calls to gtk_object_get_data() will return NULL.
Use gtk_object_data_try_key() and gtk_object_data_force_id() to get an id from a string.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_remove_no_notify_by_id ()

warning.para: gtk_object_remove_no_notify_by_id is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use g_object_steal_qdata() instead.

refsect2.para: Just like gtk_object_remove_no_notify() except that it takes a GQuark instead of a string, so it is slightly faster.
Use gtk_object_data_try_key() and gtk_object_data_force_id() to get an id from a string.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_data_try_key

warning.para: gtk_object_data_try_key is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Useless deprecated macro. Ignore it.

refsect2.title: gtk_object_data_force_id

warning.para: gtk_object_data_force_id is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Useless deprecated macro. Ignore it.

refsect2.title: The "user-data" property
refsect2.para: Anonymous User Data Pointer.

refsect2.title: The "destroy" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkObject *object, gpointer user_data) : Cleanup / No Recursion / No Hooks
refsect2.para: Signals that all holders of a reference to the GtkObject should release the reference that they hold. May result in finalization of the object if all references are released.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
